briefdescription.para: Compile and call an anonymous function.

detaileddescription.para: Compiles an anonymous function inside the #JSContext passed, then executes it within the context passed.

parameterdescription.para: char * - the source code of the function to compile
#JSContext - the Javascript context to compile and execute in

detaileddescription.para: Sets up all of the function arguments for a trigger, and calls a trigger function. This also determines the result type and generates a resulting return Datum for postgres to injest.

simplesect.para: #Datum containing the return value from the trigger

briefdescription.para: Sets up the pljs_storage object and stores it in the #JSContext.
Store the pljs_storage object in the #JSContext.

detaileddescription.para: Initialize the extension, setting up the cache, GUCs, and QuickJS runtime.
Sets up the GUCs that help define the behavior of the interpreter.

briefdescription.para: Converts a Javascript error into a string.

detaileddescription.para: Takes a javascript context and converts it into a string, allocating the memory needed in the currect memory context.
Sets up the pljs_context with the function and any needed contexts.

parameterdescription.para: #FunctionCallInfo - optional, allows for the fn_oid to be added
#HeapTuple - information pointer for the source and argument information
pljs_context - context to set up the function into

briefdescription.para: Check to see if there is permission to execute a function.

detaileddescription.para: Searches the catalog for a function and checks to see if the current user has permission to execute it.

briefdescription.para: Validates and runs the pljs.start_proc if there is one.

detaileddescription.para: Finds, verifies, and executes a pljs.start_proc if one is set. This is executed whenever a new context is created.

briefdescription.para: Converts all function call arguments from postgres to Javascript.

detaileddescription.para: Allocates and creates an array of arguments as Javascript values.

simplesect.para: an array of #JSValueConst values of the function arguments

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the pljs_storage for a given #JSContext.

detaileddescription.para: We stash a pljs_storage object as an opaque object connected to the pljs global Javascript object. This contains important function call contexts that allow us to do the conversions that we need.

Calls Javascript in some form from PostgreSQL, returning the result on success, or throwing an error on exception. Calls can be of types function, procedure, do, or trigger, and are dispatched from this entry point.
Executes whatever is passed as a DO call in postgres, does not accept any arguments to the call, nor allow for any returned data.
Calls a Javascript function returning the result on success, or throwing an error on exception.

briefdescription.para: Compile a javascript function and return a pointer to it.

detaileddescription.para: Sets up the arguments and code of a javascript function, compiles it, and returns the function itself for use.

parameterdescription.para: pljs_context - context to compile it into, which also has the current function
#bool - whether it is to be called as a trigger or not, this determines arguments

detaileddescription.para: Calls a Javascript function returning the result on success, or throwing an error on exception.

parameterdescription.para: #JSValueConst - array of arguments as Javascript values

simplesect.para: #Datum containing the return value from the function

detaileddescription.para: Sets up all of the function arguments for a set returning function, and calls it. Generally output is returned with pljs.return_next(), but if there are additional results returned, then they are appended as well. This also determines the result type and generates a resulting return Datum for postgres to injest.

parameterdescription.para: #JSValueConst - array of arguments as Javascript values

simplesect.para: #Datum containing the return value from the function

detaileddescription.para: Throws a Javascript exception and fills it with the message passed, along with as much context as it can derive from the current state of Postgres when the exception is called.

parameterdescription.para: const char * - message to throw with

briefdescription.para: Finds a pljs function and returns the JSValue of the function.

detaileddescription.para: Finds a function by its #Oid, compiles it in its own context, and returns a #JSValue containing a compiled version of the function. Note that no permissions checks are done, it is assumed these are done before calling.

parameterdescription.para: #JSContext - if NULL, the cached ctx will be used

simplesect.para: #JSValue representation of either the function if it exists of JS_UNDEFINED if it does not
